September 30, 1949
Mr. Richard B. Hull
Radio Station W0I
Iowa State College
Ames, Iowa
Dear Dick;
I have not answered jour various communications for the last three
weeks because I have been speaking all over the state to Alabama Feder¬
ation of Womens Clubs In the interest of organizing radio councils and
promoting a series of thirty minute weekly broadcasts which will be
correlated with the club study work of the federated clubs of the state.
I took up the matter of an appearance at the TV hearings with my
dean and he and I were of the opinion that the statement which the
president sent for your brief on that subject was as far as we could
go at the present time and there would be little point in our sending
a represehtative. Yesterday, however, os the result of a letter from
Dr. Bevis, our president asked us to review our stand on It and ad¬
vise him. I am hoping to get a reaction from our committee by Monday
end will let you know Immediately if we wish to have a representative
at Washington. I still think the answer will be no.
In your honest opinion, would It help the HAKB TV presentation
for us to send © man up there unless that man could say ”we definitely
expect the University of Alabama to own and operate it3 own TV station
within the next five to ten years.”
About the transcribed net—I feel that we should go ahead with
plans for that net on as many stations aa we^can as soon as possible.
It will Indicate to the ford foundation that we are trying. If we got
money from the Foundation, then this activity can be absorbed within
the Foundation plan. Apparently everybody la too busy In starting
their fall schedule to react to my letters on this subject, however.
I shall be in Ann Arbor on Friday if at all possible. I have a
Thursday morning date in Birmingham which I cannot cancel and I have
not been able to work out a schedule which will get me out of Birmingham
Thursday noon and into Ann Arbor earlier than Friday noon. In any
event, I shall see you In Ann Arbor as soon as possible.
Yours very sincerely.
Graydon Ausmus, Director
Radio Broadcasting Services
GA/ns
P.S. We should have WUOA(FM) rolling by the first of November.
